title: the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the
heading: 3. Schedule 5 of the 2017 Regulations, as inserted by Article 10 of
text_raw:
3. Schedule 5 of the 2017 Regulations, as inserted by Article 10 of 

the 2018 Regulations, is substituted by the following Schedule 5: 

“Schedule 5 

Conditions applying in relation to Derogation 

The following are the conditions for the purposes of Article 36 (1) of 
these Regulations in relation to the application to land on a holding in 
any year of livestock manure in excess of the amount specified in 
Article 20(1): 

Application of manure, other fertilisers and lime
text_norm: 3 schedule 5 2017 regulation inserted article 10 2018 regulation substituted following schedule 5 schedule 5 condition applying relation derogation following condition purpose article 36 (1) regulation relation application land holding year livestock manure excess amount specified article 20(1) application manure fertiliser lime

title: the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the
the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the
heading: The amount of livestock manure from grazing livestock applied to the
text_raw:
2. 

The amount of livestock manure from grazing livestock applied to the 
land each year on grassland farms, including by the animals themselves, 
shall not exceed the amount of manure containing 250 kg nitrogen per 
hectare, subject to the conditions laid down in paragraphs 2 to 7. 

The total nitrogen inputs shall neither exceed the foreseeable nutrient 
demand of the considered crop, nor the maximum fertilisation rate 
applicable to the grassland farm, established in the Nitrates Action 
Programme and shall take into account the supply from the soil. Total 
nitrogen application shall be differentiated on the basis of stocking rate 
and grassland productivity. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [40]
text_norm: 2 amount livestock manure grazing livestock applied land year grassland farm including animal shall exceed amount manure containing 250 kg nitrogen per hectare subject condition laid paragraph 2 7 total nitrogen input shall neither exceed foreseeable nutrient demand considered crop maximum fertilisation rate applicable grassland farm established nitrate action programme shall take account supply soil total nitrogen application shall differentiated basis stocking rate grassland productivity 4 40

title: the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the
heading: 3. A fertilisation plan shall be prepared and kept for each grassland farm
text_raw:
3. A fertilisation plan shall be prepared and kept for each grassland farm 
describing the crop rotation of the farmland and the planned application 
of manure and other fertilisers. The livestock manure and chemical 
fertiliser allowance for the holding in the fertiliser plan shall not include 
parcels of commonage or rough grazing, as declared by the applicant on 
their Basic Payment Scheme application in 2019, at rates greater than 
those applicable to 170 kg N/ha. The fertilisation plan shall be available 
at the grassland farm for each calendar year before 1 March of that year. 
The fertilisation plan shall comprise at least the following: 

(a) The crop rotation plan, which must specify the acreage of parcels 
with grass and parcels with other crops, including a sketch map 
indicating the location of individual parcels; 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

(e) 

(f) 

(g) 

(h) 

(i) 

(j) 

the number of livestock on the grassland farm, a description of the 
housing and storage system, including the volume of manure 
storage available; 

a calculation of manure nitrogen and phosphorus produced on the 
grassland farm; 

the amount, type and characteristics of manure delivered outside 
the grassland farm or to the grassland farm; 

the foreseeable nitrogen and phosphorus crop requirements for each 
parcel; 

results of soil analysis related to nitrogen and phosphorus soil 
status if available; 

the nature of the fertiliser to be used; 

a calculation of nitrogen and phosphorus application from manure 
for each parcel; 

a calculation of nitrogen and phosphorus application from chemical 
and other fertilisers for each parcel; 

a calculation of liming requirements for each parcel to achieve 
optimum soil pH; 

(k) 

a lime application programme for the grassland farm; 

(l) 

a record of the grass produced annually on the holding. 

The fertilisation plan shall be revised no later than seven days following 
any change in agricultural practices at the grassland farm.

title: the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the
heading: Fertilisation accounts, including information related to management of
text_raw:
4. 

Fertilisation accounts, including information related to management of 
lime, nitrogen and phosphorus inputs and management of soiled water, 
shall be prepared and kept for each grassland farm. They shall be 
submitted to the competent authority for each calendar year by 31 March 
of the following calendar year.
text_norm: 4 fertilisation account including information related management lime nitrogen phosphorus input management soiled water shall prepared kept grassland farm shall submitted competent authority calendar year 31 march following calendar year

title: the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the
heading: Information related to manure transferred off the holding shall be
text_raw:
5. 

Information related to manure transferred off the holding shall be 
submitted to the competent authority by 31 October each year. 

 
 
 
 [40] 5
text_norm: 5 information related manure transferred holding shall submitted competent authority 31 october year 40 5

title: the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the
heading: Periodic pH, nitrogen and phosphorus analysis in soil shall be done for
text_raw:
6. 

Periodic pH, nitrogen and phosphorus analysis in soil shall be done for 
each grassland farm. 

Sampling and analysis shall be carried out at least once every four years 
for each homogeneous area of the grassland farm, with regard to crop 
rotation and soil characteristics. 

At least one analysis per five hectares of farmland shall be carried out. 

The results of pH, nitrogen and phosphorus analysis in soil shall be 
available at the grassland farm.
text_norm: 6 periodic ph nitrogen phosphorus analysis soil shall done grassland farm sampling analysis shall carried least every four year homogeneous area grassland farm regard crop rotation soil characteristic least one analysis per five hectare farmland shall carried out result ph nitrogen phosphorus analysis soil shall available grassland farm

title: the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the
heading: Livestock manure shall not be spread in the autumn before grass
text_raw:
7. 

Livestock manure shall not be spread in the autumn before grass 
cultivation.
text_norm: 7 livestock manure shall spread autumn grass cultivation

title: the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the
heading: 8. At least 50% of slurry produced on the holding shall be applied by 15
text_raw:
8. At least 50% of slurry produced on the holding shall be applied by 15 
June each year. Low emission slurry spreading equipment shall be used 
for any slurry applications after 15 April 2020.
text_norm: 8 least 50 slurry produced holding shall applied 15 june year low emission slurry spreading equipment shall used slurry application 15 april 2020

title: the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the
heading: Crude protein in concentrate feeds for grazing livestock shall be reduced
text_raw:
9. 

Crude protein in concentrate feeds for grazing livestock shall be reduced 
in accordance with guidance issued under Article 22(2).
text_norm: 9 crude protein concentrate feed grazing livestock shall reduced accordance guidance issued article 22(2)

title: the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the
heading: 10. Temporary grassland shall be ploughed in Spring.
text_raw:
10. Temporary grassland shall be ploughed in Spring. 

Land management
text_norm: 10 temporary grassland shall ploughed spring land management

title: the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the
heading: 11. Ploughed grass on all soil types shall be followed immediately by a crop
text_raw:
11. Ploughed grass on all soil types shall be followed immediately by a crop 

with high nitrogen demand.
text_norm: 11 ploughed grass soil type shall followed immediately crop high nitrogen demand

title: the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the
heading: 12. Crop rotation shall not include leguminous or other plants fixing
text_raw:
12. Crop rotation shall not include leguminous or other plants fixing 
atmospheric nitrogen. This shall, however, not apply to clover in 
grassland with less than 50% clover and to other leguminous plants that 
are under sown with grass.
text_norm: 12 crop rotation shall include leguminous plant fixing atmospheric nitrogen shall however apply clover grassland le 50 clover leguminous plant sown grass

title: the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the
heading: 13. Grass reseeding on grassland farms shall include a minimum clover
text_raw:
13. Grass reseeding on grassland farms shall include a minimum clover 
content of 1.5kg/ha naked seed and 2.5 kg/ha pelleted seed and not 
exceed 50% of the sward mixture.
text_norm: 13 grass reseeding grassland farm shall include minimum clover content 1.5kg ha naked seed 2.5 kg ha pelleted seed exceed 50 sward mixture

title: the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the
heading: 14. Hedgerows on the holding shall be managed in accordance with guidance
text_raw:
14. Hedgerows on the holding shall be managed in accordance with guidance 
issued under Article 22(2) and management practices shall include, as a 
minimum, the following: 

(a) 

one mature whitethorn/ blackthorn tree shall be retained in each 
hedgerow; 

(b) hedgerows shall be maintained on a minimum 3-year cutting cycle. 

Training
text_norm: 14 hedgerow holding shall managed accordance guidance issued article 22(2) management practice shall include minimum following (a) one mature whitethorn blackthorn tree shall retained hedgerow (b) hedgerow shall maintained minimum 3-year cutting cycle training

title: the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the
heading: 15. From 1st January 2022, any repeat application under Article
text_raw:
15. From 1st January 2022, any repeat application under Article 
36(1)(a) shall be accompanied by evidence of participation in an 
approved training programme in nutrient use efficiency and the 
protection of water. 

 
 
 
 
 
 6 [40]
text_norm: 15 1st january 2022 repeat application article 36(1)(a) shall accompanied evidence participation approved training programme nutrient use efficiency protection water 6 40

title: the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the
heading: In these schedules, the following definitions shall apply:
text_raw:
16. 

In these schedules, the following definitions shall apply: 

Definitions 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

(e) 

(f) 

(g) 

(h) 

(i) 

‘grassland farms’ means holdings where 80 % or more of the 
agricultural area available for manure application is grass; 

‘grazing livestock’ means cattle (with the exclusion of veal calves), 
sheep, deer, goats and horses; 

‘grass’ means permanent grassland or 
(temporary implying leys of less than four years); 

temporary grassland 

‘parcel’ means an 
individual field or a group of fields, 
homogeneous regarding cropping, soil type and fertilisation 
practices; 

‘fertilisation plan’ means an advance calculation about the planned 
use and availability of nutrients; 

‘fertilisation account’ means the nutrient balance based on the real 
use and uptake of nutrients; 

‘Commonage’ means a parcel which is held by two or more 
persons in specified shares or jointly and originally purchased from 
the Irish Land Commission under the Land Purchase Acts, 
including land over which two or more persons have grazing rights 
or the right to take turf; 

‘Rough grazing’ means parcels which are permanent grazings with 
low yield, and which are only suitable for extensive grazing; 

‘Basic Payment Scheme’ is a financial support scheme under the 
” 
Common Agricultural Policy. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for Housing, 
Planning and Local Government, 

6 February, 2020. 

EOGHAN MURPHY, 

 Minister for Housing, Planning and Local Government. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [40] 7

title: the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

These Regulations amend the European Union (Good Agricultural Practice for 
Protection of Waters) Regulations 2017. The purpose of the amendment is to 
give effect to the review of the Nitrates Derogation requirements in 2019 and 
provide greater protection for water quality from agricultural activities. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 8 [40]
